title: Monsoon Update – Heavy Rainfall Likely in 13 States Within 12 Hours, Cold to Intensify - Times Bull
article_text:
Monsoon Update – Rainfall in several locations across the country late last night brought down temperatures. This rainfall occurred mostly in the southern and northeastern states. Following the rain in the northeastern states, a period of cold has begun. Snowfall is increasing in the hilly areas of Himachal Pradesh, and the number of tourists is also increasing.

People are arriving from far and wide to enjoy the snow. Winter is also increasing in Uttarakhand and Kashmir. Delhi NCR, Haryana, and Uttar Pradesh are now experiencing a chill. Yesterday, Uttar Pradesh experienced a sunny day. Although a western disturbance brought some cloud cover to some parts, the weather remained unaffected. The Indian Meteorological Department has predicted rain in several states across the country. Full Weather Report

Rainfall May Occur in These States

According to the Indian Meteorological Department, the weather will remain rough and rainy in some states for three days. The IMD has predicted thunderstorms and rain in several areas of Tamil Nadu, Kerala, and Andhra Pradesh. Heavy rains are also possible at some places in Karnataka, Maharashtra, and Telangana. The rains will bring pleasant weather.

Rain is also expected at most places in the northeastern states of Manipur, Sikkim, and Mizoram. Heavy rain alerts have also been issued for Tripura, Arunachal Pradesh, Nagaland, and Puducherry. The cold wave is expected to increase significantly after the rains.

Delhi NCR Weather

The Meteorological Department has predicted clear weather in Delhi NCR for a few days. Fog will be visible in the mornings, but the sun will shine as the day progresses. Furthermore, the sky is expected to remain cloudy for the next two days, with air quality also expected to deteriorate.

Cold to increase in the state

According to the IMD, light sunshine has begun to appear in Uttar Pradesh, indicating an increase in cold weather. The weather is expected to remain dry throughout the state for the next week. Similar weather is expected in both the western and eastern parts from November 6th to 10th.

Weather in Uttarakhand

According to the Meteorological Department, temperatures are dropping in the land of the gods, Uttarakhand. Dry weather is expected for three days. Fog is expected in the plains and snowfall in the mountains. According to the Meteorological Department, hilly districts like Dehradun, Uttarkashi, Chamoli, as well as Tehri, Bageshwar, Rudraprayag, and Pithoragarh may experience significant snowfall.
